titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to James F. Tureman
CWG13768

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1864 Clothing, Camp & Garrison Equipage, Telegraph Expenses, Some Claim Letters; Bundle 1

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To J. F. Tureman, Dr.

row.cell: For Services rendered in assisting the Organization of the Enrolled Militia to date 16 days.

body.p: The Q M General is ordered to pay this claim out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D. W. Lindsey
Inspector General of Ky
Received at Frankfort Ky, the 16 of May 1864, of S G Suddarth, Quarter-master ^Genl of^ Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of forty four Dollars, and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To J. F. Tureman, Dr.

row.cell: For Services rendered in assisting the organization of the Enrolled Militia to date 16 days.

body.p: The Q. M. General is ordered to pay this claim out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D. W. Lindsey
Inspector General of Ky
Received at Frankfort Ky, the 16th of May 1864, of S. G. Suddarth, Quarter-master ^Genl of^ Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of forty four Dollars, and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. Abstract B Qr. 186.
Jas F Tureman
Dollars -- 44. 00/100
Paid May 16th, 1864
(5)
(Militia -- No. 5.)
